properties.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands; Eastern Alaska Range; Denali; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Deltana and Tanana Flats
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 2:44PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
Temperatures around the Interior will fall into the 30s to 50
below this weekend.

Cold air will push southeast across the state Thursday and Friday,
then settle over the area through the weekend as the atmosphere
continues to cool.

The coldest temperatures will be southeast of a line from Fort
Yukon to Livengood to Lake Minchumina. Temperatures along the
AlCan Border are expected to fall to as low as 50 below, while
temperatures in the Middle Tanana Valley will fall into the 30s
below Sunday and Monday before starting to warm. High temperatures
will only be 5 to 10 degrees warmer than the lows.

Residents should prepare for the cold, especially if traveling,
by keeping cold weather gear available at all times.

For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.

NWSheadline: Another Round of Very Cold Temperatures Coming
